alert.note: Alert for Garza; Kent; Stonewall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 2:57PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Kent, southeastern Garza and western Stonewall Counties through 330 PM CDT... At 257 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles south of Clairemont, or 16 miles southwest of Jayton, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jayton, Lake Alan Henry, Girard, Peacock and Clairemont. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
